int  nbCols 
)

Allocates a float RGBa color raster image at the dimensions specified.

Allocates a float RGBa color raster at the specified dimensions and initializes this raster to zero values (black). Row and column indices of the new raster start at 0

Parameters
nbRowsnumber of rows of the raster
nbColsnumber of columns of the raster

RasterImage_RGBa_F::RasterImage_RGBa_F ( const RasterImage_RGBa_F &  img)
private

Allocates a float RGBa color raster image at the dimensions and with the values specified by the RasterImage object received as parameter.

If the image is not of type RGBa32, does a conversion. This copy contructor is not operative, and was only declared to eliminate compiler warnings.

void RasterImage_RGBa_F::copyInto ( RasterImage *  imgOut) const
virtual

Copies this image into the one received as parameter.

Copies (rather than clones) this image into the destination image received as parameter. Depending on the types of this image and of the destination image, the copy may require some data conversion (for example, HSV to Lab). If the raster(s) of the destination image does not have the same dimensions as the source, then the destination image's raster are re-allocated.

Parameters
imgOutpointer to the destination image

privatevirtual

Sets a new bounding rectangle for the raster image.

A raster image occupies a rectangle within the global image space. For example, a RasterImage could be defined as a subimage of another image. This operation may require a reallocation of the image.

This function may be called or overridden by child classes that have their own raster

Parameters

yvertical coordinate of upper left corner
theWidthdesired width of the image
theHeightdesired height of the image

1248  fGreen[i][j] = rgba[i][k++];
1249  fBlue[i][j] = rgba[i][k++];

Here is the call graph for this function:

void RasterImage_RGBa_F::writeInto_ ( RasterImage *  imgOut,
const ImageRect *  rect,
const ImagePoint *  origin 
) const
privatevirtual

Writes into another image the part of this image specified by a rectangle, using the point specified as origin for this image's valid rectangle's upper-left corner.

Contrary to copyInto this function does not resize the destination image if it is smaller than the source. It does not even modify the valid data rectangle of the destination image. It just writes in the intersection of the destination rectangle and of this image's valid data rectangle. Fails if the destination rectangle is not contained by the source image.

Parameters
imgOutthe image to write into
rectspecifies the part of the source to write into the destination
originthe point to use as origin for this image's valid data rectangle's upper-left corner.

Reimplemented from uriVL::RasterImage_RGBa.
